column4: hello all. I've booted into a live cd and am trying to repartition. I've screencapped my Gparted window - http://i41.tinypic.com/2dca81s.png I need to take some hd space away from /dev/sda1 and give it to /dev/sda6. Help?
I've tried resizing /dev/sda1 but I can't allocate the resulting free space to /dev/sda6
did you notice that warning sign on sda3?
yep, was wondering what that meant
looks like -o isn't a valid option. perhaps you meant -i?
why do you have two swaps?
you see, I had a previous install of Ubuntu and decided to wipe my Ubuntu partition and do a clean install.
now all I did was delete my ubuntu partition in windows
the ~300mb swap is from the earlier install, the ~100mb from the install I did just now
would it be safe to delete the 300mb swap?
yes you actually dont need the swap
okay, imma delete the 300mb swap then. :)
looks like I can't delete 'em. tells me to unmount any logical partition having a higher number than 5. no biggie though
there's 15gb of unallocated space right now, just next to my /dev/sda6 (I haven't committed the resize yet, though). Still can't allocate that new space for /dev/sda6
